values.0: Typical angina: chest pain related to decreased blood supply to the heart
values.1: Atypical angina: chest pain not related to heart
values.2: Non-anginal pain: typically esophageal spasms (non-heart related)
values.3: Asymptomatic: chest pain not showing signs of disease

trestbps.description: resting blood pressure (in mm Hg on admission to the hospital)
trestbps.note: Anything above 130-140 is typically cause for concern

chol.note: serum = LDL + HDL + 0.2 * triglycerides. Above 200 is cause for concern

values.1: ST-T Wave abnormality (can range from mild symptoms to severe problems, signals non-normal heartbeat)
values.2: Possible or definite left ventricular hypertrophy (Enlarged heart's main pumping chamber)

oldpeak.description: ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest
oldpeak.note: Looks at stress of heart during exercise. Unhealthy heart will stress more

slope.description: the slope of the peak exercise ST segment

values.0: Upsloping: better heart rate with exercise (uncommon)

ca.description: number of major vessels (0-3) colored by fluoroscopy
ca.note: Colored vessel means the doctor can see the blood passing through. The more blood movement the better (no clots)

values.6: Fixed defect: used to be defect but ok now
values.7: Reversable defect: no proper blood movement when exercising

target.description: Have disease or not (1 = yes, 0 = no)
